title: Piratopia: Raiders of Pirate Bay
tagline: Conquer the Seven Seas in this open-world Pirate Ship multiplayer game for PC!

0: When is your game going to be launched?

The original Piratopia is already available as a free-to-play demo on Steam. We are aiming for the new game, Piratopia: Raiders of Pirate Bay, to be accessible for beta or early access around Nov 2023.
1: Will there be a demo version available?
Yes! The original Piratopia is available as a free demo on Steam here: https://store.steampowered.com/app/1681160/Piratopia/.
2: We are expecting manufacturing to be completed and shipping to begin Nov 2023.

risks:
Risks and challenges

Project 99 has worked hard to prepare and gather support for this game because we believe in it. Our goal is to make a game that gamers want, set in a fantastical world of pirates.

By backing this campaign, you'll become a part of this process. During and after the campaign, we plan to keep you involved so we can understand how you would rather play the game— from game balancing and prioritizing systems, to choosing new content, art, and graphics.

While development delays are always possible, we are a veteran team of dedicated video game creators that understand the complexities involved with development and Live operations. We are committed to realistic timelines and goals and promise to communicate regularly and transparently at each phase.
story:
Arr, ye scallywags - on deck. We be taking this ship places in the name of friendship, adventure, and treasure!



I hope your twitch reflexes are good. You’ll be fighting, trading, negotiating. And then fighting some more. Navigate through treacherous, monster-infested waters, take on the dreaded Navy, trade, explore dungeons and make friends and foes alike as you explore a new world!



With over 200,000 downloads on Steam, you won’t be sailing alone. Come on board and feel the breeze in your beards* as we sail into a new chapter for Piratopia together!



*for the unbearded, hook-ons are available for a modest fee.



Piratopia's Creator

The brainchild of Adi Zhavo, Game Director at Popcore and creator of cult PvP arena brawler Gladio & Glory, Piratopia began its life as a one-man project developed during off-work hours while Adi juggled full-time work as a Game Producer.



Now, in collaboration with Project 99, Piratopia is getting a major upgrade from an addictive IO-style sea brawler to a brand new multiplayer game with a graphic overhaul, a bigger world, and tons of new features!



Map of Astillia

Before his death, "Bloodhound" Addicus left pages of his journal scattered across the Seven Seas of Astillia, detailing several ancient monuments lost beneath the waves. Legend has it that anyone who manages to retrieve these monuments will be granted untold riches and ultimate mastery of the oceans.



Factions

Choose whether to ally or war with the many world factions in Piratopia, and reap the rewards as you unlock unique quests while building your reputation with them.

Factions in Piratopia may offer you different trade options and access to different materials and crew. It's up to you to discover them all!

Featuring three unique classes (and three more on the way), sail the Seven Seas and lay waste to your enemies as the high-speed Cruiser, the hard-wearing Dreadnought, or the devastating Destroyer. Master their unique playstyles and skills, and make the seas your…old salty dog.



Gear

How well your ship runs isn’t arbitrary. From extra armor plating to hyper propellers, no pirate worth their salt would ever leave their ship's gear unattended and un-upgraded!

Each ship gets up to five Gear slots. Gear is important – what you choose can make the difference between moving faster, being more durable, or having more firepower. Choose the right build for an edge in different encounters.

You also get up to three weapon slots. This is how you’ll lay waste to enemies. As you get stronger, you’ll have to choose between your elements of destruction. Will you be a massive tank, mowing down all before you? Or a speedy cruiser, pewpew-ing with lasers?

And the pretty pretty sparklies…the gems. Who knows what they might do to your gear, eh?



Weaponry

What CAN’T you attack people with? From basic cannonballs to flamethrowers and lasers, it’s your pick in Piratopia, what flavor of annihilation your enemy gets. Oh, you’ll start basic, but I think you’d be surprised by how quickly that changes. Welcome to Piratopia, cake or death?



Crafting

A crafty boy (or girl), eh? I did say it was all about the gear. Through gear crafting, you can tweak and balance your stats all you want as you pirate your way through the world. You can get resources from combat or trading to upgrade current gear, or combine them into higher-level ones. Dismantle the dreck you don’t need while waiting on those rare boss materials.



Crew

You’ll encounter a plethora of "recruitable" and powerful NPCs as you sail across the seas! Your job, as the greatest Pirate that ever lived, is to convince these sea rogues, legends in their own right, to accept you as their captain and join your motley crew to conquer the oceans together.

Hint: Each collectible crew member comes with his/her own unique skill set that may give you an edge in different encounters or over various foes.

In Piratopia: Raiders of Pirate Bay, you’ll face naval war fleets, pesky monsters, and more unspeakable oceanic horrors spoken about only in legends. You can choose to cooperate with other players to challenge lethal world bosses, or team up with friends to raid dungeons in each biome.

More risk brings more reward because you have a chance to score rare and important relics and materials when you do take down one of the mythical creatures of the deep.









Clans

Rally your mates to trade, raid and battle together as the mightiest flotilla ever seen on Astillia. In Piratopia: Raiders of Pirate Bay, you will be able to create your own Pirate Clans and enjoy perks such as:

Cross-server clan banks

Clan buffs

Clan quests and rewards

Auction House

Wheel and deal with other enterprising players in a cross-server auction house, where you have the chance to score rare loot or become the mightiest trader of them all.



Player vs Player

Ready to show off your mastery?



The bloodthirsty will be able to engage in open-world naval PVP with other players, either in a flotilla of 4 or as a solo mercenary – but be prepared for a bounty on your head as other players are invited to hunt you down!



Ships can also engage in different PVP modes within specific arenas ranging from 1v1 to 4v4. By battling in arena PVP, you will unlock new skins and titles exclusive to only those most skilled in naval skirmishes.



Will yours be the name that strikes fear in the hearts of a generation of seamen?



Help us unlock more biomes by hitting our stretch goals!

With a vast array of biomes for open exploration, from the tropical Sunny Islands to the depths of the Sunken Abyss, each zone brings its own unique climate and denizens to the world of Astillia.



Different dungeons

Different enemies

Different environmental hazards

As you travel across the seas, you’ll also encounter different NPCs, factions and enemies, each with their own unique tales and backstories. In-depth narratives and PVE experiences will give all explorers a chance to immerse themselves in a rich world and write their own legends.

Acclaimed composer and performer Adrian Berenguer (also known as ANBR) has worked on music for prestigious brands, movies and video games, earning himself international recognition for original compositions from the International Festival of Environmental Films of Chefchaouen and the Playstation® Talents Music award.

Following a successful crowdfunding campaign, Piratopia will feature a full original gameplay soundtrack scored by ANBR.



Helmed by industry veterans who have worked on extensive development and publishing projects across multiple platforms, Project 99's mission is to support developers with great ideas and turn promising concepts into unforgettable game experiences.



Adi, as the brain behind Piratopia, continues to be involved in providing creative input on the project.



Our #1 priority is to build a game YOU want to play, so our approach from day one has been to involve the community every step of the way, from deciding the art style to prioritizing game systems. What you see now is the culmination of months of polling and feedback from the OG fans of Piratopia, combined with fresh game design, art, tech, and operational input from our team of passionate experts.



We aim to build the pirate ship multiplayer game of our dreams, and we promise to continue being transparent in our process and progress as we embark on the next leg of our journey together!
